entry.title: Kim de l'Horizon (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Kim de l'Horizon (pictured), winner of the 2022 German Book Prize, shaved their head during the award ceremony in solidarity with those protesting in Iran?

entry.title: Verrado High School (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that in 2016 Verrado High School in Arizona began offering all-female engineering classes?

entry.title: Lin Changyi (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Chinese scholar Lin Changyi likened the miracles of Jesus to Daoist magic?

entry.title: Surf Curse (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that despite their song "Freaks" going platinum after becoming popular on TikTok, members of Surf Curse said they neither understood nor used the app?

entry.title: Carolyn Grace (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Carolyn Grace was the only qualified female pilot of the Supermarine Spitfire ever to take part in display flying?

entry.title: a 1982 court case (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that a 1982 court case established that video games may qualify for multiple types of U.S. copyright protection?

entry.title: Bohemian harp (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Bohemian harp spread to Western Europe after a fire hit the town of Přísečnice?

entry.title: "Biff" Bangs (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that pigeon racer "Biff" Bangs previously played for two different teams in Rose Bowl football games?
